Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior glazed black; exterior: single black band at junction of lip and body; in handle zone, part of incised palmette and lotus bud chain with added red on palmette hearts, alternating fronds and lotus buds.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
This sherd may well be that attributed by Beazley to the manner of the C Painter (ABV 59, 19).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 377, no. B522)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0374) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
